text: L. Jacques Ménard, , (January 29, 1946 - February 5, 2020) was a Canadian businessman and educator. He was the chancellor of Concordia University from 2011 to 2014. He was born in Chicoutimi, Quebec. Ménard died on February 5, 2020 in Montreal from a long-illness at the age of 74. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:Canadian academics Category:Canadian businesspeople Category:People from Quebec Category:2020 deaths
title: L. Jacques Ménard
